cast.overview: In Los Angeles, a wealthy man, known as Mr. Fuller, discovers a shocking secret about the world he lives in. Fearing for his life, he leaves a desperate message for a friend of his in the most unexpected place.
cast.title: The Thirteenth Floor

cast.overview: Ten years after she was separated from her family, an eighteen-year-old orphan with vague memories of the past sets out to Paris in hopes of reuniting with her grandmother. She is accompanied by two con men, who intend to pass her off as the Grand Duchess Anastasia to the Dowager Empress for a reward.
cast.title: Anastasia

cast.overview: Pakistan-born comedian Kumail Nanjiani and grad student Emily Gardner fall in love but struggle as their cultures clash. When Emily contracts a mysterious illness, Kumail finds himself forced to face her feisty parents, his family's expectations, and his true feelings.
cast.title: The Big Sick

details.biography: Jeff Blumenkrantz (born June 3, 1965) is an American actor, composer and lyricist. His stage credits include roles in the Broadway productions Into the Woods (1987), The Threepenny Opera (1989), Damn Yankees (1994), How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying (1995), A Class Act (2001), and Bright Star (2016). Blumenkrantz has also appeared in such television shows as Succession, Pose, Mr. Robot, The Blacklist, Fosse/Verdon, The Detour, Will & Grace, 30 Rock, The Good Wife, Ugly Betty, Just Shoot Me!, and Law & Order, and the films The Big Sick and Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat. As a songwriter, Blumenkrantz is most noted for his work on the 2003 musical adaptation of Urban Cowboy, which earned him a Tony Award nomination for Best Original Score (shared with Jason Robert Brown and others).
details.name: Jeff Blumenkrantz
